ObjectName.value: Oltos ARV 61 74 youth sitting on a stool - ransom of Hektor (11)

Categories.value: Details of ancient Greek pottery|Oltos|Red-figure pottery in the Staatliche Antikensammlungen|Self-published work

ImageDescription.value:
object type / vase shape: attic red figure cup (kylix)

- description interior: youth sitting on a stool, holding a sprig - exterior side A: Priamos, led by Hermes, comes to Achilles (feasting on a klinie) to ask him to return the body of Hektor, lying underneath the kline; behind Achilles stands a girl (Briseis?) and a warrior - side A and B: servants (of Priamos) carry presents for Achilles (as ransom); close reminiscence (though rather a condensation than an illustration) of the scene in Homer, Ilias 24, 413ff; name inscriptions and MEMNON KALOS - production place: Athens - painter: Oltos - period / date: late archaic, ca. 510 BC - material: pottery (clay) - diameter: 33 cm - findspot: Vulci - museum / inventory number: München, Staatliche Antikensammlungen 2618 - bibliography: John D. Beazley, Attic Red-Figure Vase-Painters, Oxford 1963(2), 61, 74

- Please note: The above museum permits photography of its exhibits for private, educational, scientific, non-commercial purposes. If you intend to use the photo for any commercial aime, please contact the museum and ask for permission.
